chunk: Falafel This tasty falafel recipe goes well with hummus for your baby to explore new tastes and textures. Falafel is great for lunchboxes too. Age: 6 months and older Prep: 10 mins Cook: 15 mins Portions: 10 (approx) Ingredients - 1 tin (400g) chickpeas (no added sugar or salt), drained - 1 tbsp lemon juice - 2 tbsp (40g) tahini - 1 tsp garlic puree (or 1 clove garlic roughly chopped) - half tsp paprika - 1 tbsp vegetable oil Method Place the chickpeas, lemon juice, tahini, garlic pur√©e and paprika in a blender and blend until smooth. Add a little more lemon juice if mixture is too thick. Divide the mixture into small balls and flatten slightly. Heat the oil in a pan and cook the falafel on medium heat, for 2 to 3 minutes on each side, until golden. Allow to cool before serving one falafel in a
title: Falafel
description: This tasty falafel recipe goes well with hummus for your baby to explore new tastes and textures. Falafel is great for lunchboxes too.
ingredients: 1 tin (400g) chickpeas (no added sugar or salt), drained

chunk: oil in a pan and cook the falafel on medium heat, for 2 to 3 minutes on each side, until golden. Allow to cool before serving one falafel in a bowl for your baby to explore. Information: Store the remaining falafel in an airtight container in the fridge, or freezer, for other days.
